Description: Is the row to be published?
a sample ID, as originally provided by HCMR

Column vocabterm: Electrical conductivity of the water column

Notes: measured independently by the sampling scientist (no fixed protocol or units)

Description: Raw (volts) OR converted (mg Chla/m˄3) fluorescence of the water
Notes:
Original said could have: volts or mg Chla/m˄3. The two possible values given are not equivalent to each other, hence unless a unit is specifically given, we cannot publish this value. According to Jonas: “I don't think so, usually sensors give an output in volts if that value still needs to be converted (via certain algorithm or certain piece of processing for example). Specifically, the VPR also measures everything in volts that is subsequently converted to chl, turbidity, etc. Will be the same here.
In other words: in this case it seems to me that part of the data has already been converted from volts to mg/L (via a piece of processing unknown to us). But not everything.”

Description: Transmittance and attenuance of the water column
Column vocabterm: Transmittance and attenuance of the water column
Notes: NTU or FTU were both allowed. While two units were allowed, and they measure in a different way, the units are equivlant. Not all stations give their units, so in our published data we will use NTU (which is slightly more popular in these data) but we will need to add a flag for those that are in FTU as this indicates a different measuring method. Note: the entires in FNU are valid units, and appear to be also equivalent to FTU and NTU

Description: Abundance of cells in the water column (+other avail. cell properties)
Column vocabterm: Microzooplankton taxonomic abundance in water bodies' or 'Phytoplankton taxonomic abundance in water bodies'
Notes: while units given is m˄-3, the 2 values given are actually in count/litre = count/1000cm3. To convert to count/m3 you need to multiply the given number by 1000
